alert.note: Alert for Bay; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:27PM EDT until April 09 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Saginaw River At Saginaw affecting Saginaw and Bay Counties. .Dry conditions are forecast through the weekend, allowing the river to crest tonight and then gradually recede to below flood stage this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saginaw River At Saginaw. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:05 PM EDT Friday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is near crest and expected to fall below flood stage Saturday night after midnight. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Impact...At 18.0 feet, Houses on Riverside Drive begin to flood. Wickes Park and Green Point Nature Area in Saginaw also flood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
